CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 9, 1941, pg. 2, reads: "200 Kiddies Play Daily on Bedford Dwelling Playground - With the combined cooperation of the Works Progress Administration and the Pittsburgh Housing Authority, the playground at Bedford Dwellings is gaining a great deal of recognition in the Hill area as it is the only immediate facility for the hundreds of children in the Dwellings. At least 200 of these kiddies play here every morning and, under the able direction of Mrs. Anna Rivers, are taught a wide variety of games...  [illegible] photo was snapped as Mrs. Rivers was instructing a group of small children. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Woman, possibly recreation director Anna May Rivers, leaning over group of children seated at table, on playground at Bedford Dwellings
